definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: "Action sports is the fastest-growing segment of our business," says Jeanne Jackson, who runs Nike's direct-to-consumer business.
sentences.chinese: 極限運動用品是我們增長速度最快的業務部門。

sentences.english: It makes me nervous just to watch someone play X-sports.
sentences.chinese: 我很緊張，因爲剛看了別人玩極限運動。

sentences.english: She is the most medaled female athlete at the XG.
sentences.chinese: 她是極限運動會中獲獎最多的女性運動員。

sentences.english: Bungee jumping is avery new X-sport, but it has become popular all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 蹦極是一項新的極限運動，但它在全世界越來越流行。

sentences.english: B-BOX. Extreme sports and graffiti it might be a taste of an ordinary street passion.
sentences.chinese: 極限運動與塗鴉互相輝映，領略非一般的街頭激情。

sentences.english: Extreme sports are right up Tony's alley.
sentences.chinese: 極限運動正合東尼的胃口。

sentences.english: Chen is the first Chinese mainlander to ever attempt the grueling desert race.
sentences.chinese: 陳是中國大陸第一個挑戰這項沙漠極限運動賽的人。

definition: body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
